item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You didn’t have a . between command and startsWith. Plus you didn’t capitalize the W in with.

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:350631”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=446988.msg3280644#msg3280644 date=1279845401]

if (command.startsWith("Strange")) { if(playerHasItem(995, 80000)) { deleteItem(995, 80000); addItem(3062, 1); } }

Also you could use this.
[/quote]
Why use startWith if there’s no substring?

does it make a diffrence? btw ima asking, not being an ass

Yes, say you have two commands, strange and stranger
If you use startsWith for strange, and you do ::stranger, it will do both commands. ;)[/quote]

Knowing most people that play servers don’t watch what they type, they would most likely keep messing up before they found out they added an extra letter.

Plus it doesn’t matter which one you use, just one is more secure then the other.

Read full topic

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:3, topic:350631”]if (command.startsWith("Strange")) { if(playerHasItem(995, 80000)) { deleteItem(995, 80000); addItem(3062, 1); } }

Also you could use this.[/quote]
Why use startWith if there’s no substring?

faze1one:

does it make a diffrence? btw ima asking, not being an ass

Yes, say you have two commands, strange and stranger
If you use startsWith for strange, and you do ::stranger, it will do both commands.

Read full topic
